meanings.definition: To inoculate with smallpox virus to produce immunity
meanings.sent1: The doctor was variolating the patient to protect them from smallpox.
meanings.sent2: She variolated the children in the village to prevent the spread of the disease.
meanings.sent3: After variolating the entire family, the doctor joked that they were now a 'pox-proof' household.
meanings.sent4: The idea of variolating oneself with a virus may seem counterintuitive, but it can save lives.
meanings.sent5: The process of variolating involves introducing a weakened virus to build immunity.

meanings.definition: The act of inoculating with smallpox virus to produce immunity
meanings.sent1: Variolating was a common practice before the smallpox vaccine was developed.
meanings.sent2: The variolating of individuals helped control the spread of the disease in the community.
meanings.sent3: The variolating process was seen as a necessary evil to protect against smallpox outbreaks.
meanings.sent4: In history, variolating was a controversial method of disease prevention.
meanings.sent5: The variolating of populations was a crucial step in eradicating smallpox worldwide.
